Appendix A Related Work

There are several other related works. Dutta etÂ al., (2018) explore the error-runtime trade-offs in Distributed SGD, revealing how slower and stale gradients can sometimes enhance convergence processes. Woodworth etÂ al., (2020) compare Local SGD with Minibatch SGD, analyzing the efficiency of local updates in different distributed settings. Wu etÂ al., (2022) advance the understanding of asynchronous methods by proposing delay-adaptive step-sizes that adjust to asynchronous learning environments, optimizing the convergence rates. Furthermore, Hanna etÂ al., (2022, 2020) focus on adaptive stochastic gradient descent to improve communication efficiency in distributed learning, offering strategies that reduce communication demands while maintaining fast convergence.

Appendix B Table of Frequently Used Notation

Appendix C Heterogeneous Regime

So far, we have discussed the scenario where all workers compute i.i.d. stochastic gradients. However, in distributed optimization and federated learning (KoneÄnÃ½ etÂ al., , 2016), workers may have different datasets. Consider the following optimization problem:

minxâˆˆâ„dâ¡{fâ¢(x):=1nâ¢âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼Î¾iâˆ¼ğ’Ÿiâ¢[fiâ¢(x;Î¾i)]},subscriptğ‘¥superscriptâ„ğ‘‘assignğ‘“ğ‘¥1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘–delimited-[]subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ‘¥subscriptğœ‰ğ‘–\displaystyle\min_{x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}}\Big{\{}f(x):=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}{% \mathbb{E}}_{\xi_{i}\sim\mathcal{D}_{i}}\left[f_{i}(x;\xi_{i})\right]\Big{\}},roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_f ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] } , (5)

where fi:â„dÃ—ğ•Šiâ†’â„d:subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–â†’superscriptâ„ğ‘‘subscriptğ•Šğ‘–superscriptâ„ğ‘‘f_{i}\,:\,\mathbb{R}^{d}\times\mathbb{S}_{i}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Ã— blackboard_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â†’ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Î¾isubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–\xi_{i}italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are random variables with some distributions ğ’Ÿisubscriptğ’Ÿğ‘–\mathcal{D}_{i}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT on ğ•Šisubscriptğ•Šğ‘–\mathbb{S}_{i}blackboard_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Problem (5) generalizes problem (1).

C.1 Related work and discussion

The optimization problem (5) has been thoroughly studied in many papers, including (Aytekin etÂ al., , 2016; Mishchenko etÂ al., , 2018; Nguyen etÂ al., , 2022; Wu etÂ al., , 2022; Koloskova etÂ al., , 2022; Mishchenko etÂ al., , 2022). There have been attempts to analyze Asynchronous SGD in the heterogeneous setting. For example, Mishchenko etÂ al., (2022) demonstrated convergence only to a neighborhood of the solution. In general, achieving good rates for Asynchronous SGD is difficult without making additional assumptions about the similarity of the functions fisubscriptğ‘“ğ‘–f_{i}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (Koloskova etÂ al., , 2022; Mishchenko etÂ al., , 2022).

In the deterministic case, when Ïƒ2=0superscriptğœ20\sigma^{2}=0italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0, Wu etÂ al., (2022) analyzed the PIAG method in the deterministic heterogeneous regime and showed convergence. Although the performance of PIAG can be good in practice, in the worst case PIAG requires Oâ¡(Ï„nâ¢L^â¢Î”/Îµ)Osubscriptğœğ‘›^ğ¿Î”ğœ€\operatorname{O}\left(\nicefrac{{\tau_{n}\widehat{L}\Delta}}{{\varepsilon}}\right)roman_O ( / start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG roman_Î” end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG ) seconds to converge, where Ï„nsubscriptğœğ‘›\tau_{n}italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the time delay of the slowest worker, L^:=âˆ‘i=1nLi2,assign^ğ¿superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘–2\widehat{L}:=\sqrt{\sum_{i=1}^{n}L_{i}^{2}},over^ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG := square-root start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , and Lisubscriptğ¿ğ‘–L_{i}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a Lipschitz constant of âˆ‡fiâˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–\nabla f_{i}âˆ‡ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Note that the synchronous Minibatch SGD (see SectionÂ 1.1) method has the complexity Oâ¡(Ï„nâ¢Lâ¢Î”/Îµ)Osubscriptğœğ‘›ğ¿Î”ğœ€\operatorname{O}\left(\nicefrac{{\tau_{n}L\Delta}}{{\varepsilon}}\right)roman_O ( / start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L roman_Î” end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG ), which is always better.888In the nonconvex case, L^^ğ¿\widehat{L}over^ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG can be arbitrarily larger than Lğ¿Litalic_L.

Tyurin and RichtÃ¡rik, (2024) proposed an optimal method in the regime where worker computation times are deterministic, similar to the homogeneous setup.

C.2 Vecna SGD

Here we describe our method called Vecna SGD.

The Vecna SGD algorithm begins with an initialization at a starting point x0superscriptğ‘¥0x^{0}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in â„dsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, with a specified stepsize Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³, time allowances tisubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–t_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and trial counts Bisubscriptğµğ‘–B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for each client. In each iteration kğ‘˜kitalic_k, ranging from k=1ğ‘˜1k=1italic_k = 1 to Kğ¾Kitalic_K, the server distributes the current point xksuperscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜x^{k}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to all clients. Each client iğ‘–iitalic_i then executes a subroutine (AlgorithmÂ 4) to attempt to compute Bisubscriptğµğ‘–B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT stochastic gradients from samples Î¾ijsuperscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—\xi_{i}^{j}italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT drawn from a distribution ğ’Ÿğ’Ÿ\mathcal{D}caligraphic_D. During each attempt, client iğ‘–iitalic_i starts computing a stochastic gradient; if the computation exceeds the allotted time tisubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–t_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, they discard the current gradient and begin another computation. Consequently, the actual number of stochastic gradients received from each client iğ‘–iitalic_i becomes a random variable, ranging from 0 to Bisubscriptğµğ‘–B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The expected number of gradients from client iğ‘–iitalic_i is given by piâ¢Bisubscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–p_{i}B_{i}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The server normalizes the gradients by the expected batch size piâ¢Bisubscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–p_{i}B_{i}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and then aggregates them. Finally, the point is updated to xk+1=xkâˆ’Î³â¢gksuperscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜1superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜ğ›¾superscriptğ‘”ğ‘˜x^{k+1}=x^{k}-\gamma g^{k}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_Î³ italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT following each aggregation round.

C.3 Convergence theory

The following theorem gives iterations guarantees for the convergence of Vecna SGD.

Theorem C.1 (Proof in SectionÂ H.1).

Assume that AssumptionsÂ 4.1, 4.2 hold for the function fğ‘“fitalic_f and 4.3 holds for the function fisubscriptğ‘“ğ‘–f_{i}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for all iâˆˆ[n]ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›i\in[n]italic_i âˆˆ [ italic_n ]. Let Î³=minâ¡{1Lâ¢Î±â¢K,1Lâ¢Î²,Îµ2â¢Lâ¢Î¶}ğ›¾1ğ¿ğ›¼ğ¾1ğ¿ğ›½ğœ€2ğ¿ğœ\gamma=\min\left\{\frac{1}{\sqrt{L\alpha K}},\frac{1}{L\beta},\frac{% \varepsilon}{2L\zeta}\right\}italic_Î³ = roman_min { divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_L italic_Î± italic_K end_ARG end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L italic_Î² end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L italic_Î¶ end_ARG } in FootnoteÂ 10. Then after

Kâ‰¥12â¢Î”â¢LÎµâ¢maxâ¡{Î²,12â¢Î”â¢Î±Îµ,2â¢Î¶Îµ},ğ¾12Î”ğ¿ğœ€ğ›½12Î”ğ›¼ğœ€2ğœğœ€\displaystyle K\geq\frac{12\Delta L}{\varepsilon}\max\left\{\beta,\frac{12% \Delta\alpha}{\varepsilon},\frac{2\zeta}{\varepsilon}\right\},italic_K â‰¥ divide start_ARG 12 roman_Î” italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG roman_max { italic_Î² , divide start_ARG 12 roman_Î” italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_Î¶ end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG } ,

iterations, the method guarantees that min0â‰¤kâ‰¤Kâ¡ğ”¼â¢[â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(xk)â€–2]â‰¤Îµsubscript0ğ‘˜ğ¾ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜2ğœ€\min_{0\leq k\leq K}\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})\right\|^{2}\right]\leq\varepsilonroman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 â‰¤ italic_k â‰¤ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] â‰¤ italic_Îµ, where Î”=fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finfÎ”ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimum\Delta=f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}roman_Î” = italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and

Î±=Ln2â¢âˆ‘i=1n1âˆ’pipiâ¢Bi,Î²=1,Î¶=Ïƒ2n2â¢âˆ‘i=1n1piâ¢Bi.formulae-sequenceğ›¼ğ¿superscriptğ‘›2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›1subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–formulae-sequenceğ›½1ğœsuperscriptğœ2superscriptğ‘›2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›1subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–\alpha=\frac{L}{n^{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1-p_{i}}{p_{i}B_{i}},\quad\beta=1,% \quad\zeta=\frac{\sigma^{2}}{n^{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1}{p_{i}B_{i}}.italic_Î± = divide start_ARG italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , italic_Î² = 1 , italic_Î¶ = divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

C.4 Time Complexity

The following theorem gives time complexity for Vecna SGD.

Theorem C.2 (Proof in SectionÂ H.2).

Assume that AssumptionsÂ 4.1, 4.2 hold for the function fğ‘“fitalic_f and 4.3 holds for the function fisubscriptğ‘“ğ‘–f_{i}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for all iâˆˆ[n]ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›i\in[n]italic_i âˆˆ [ italic_n ]. Let Î³=minâ¡{1Lâ¢Î±â¢K,1L,Îµ2â¢L}ğ›¾1ğ¿ğ›¼ğ¾1ğ¿ğœ€2ğ¿\gamma=\min\left\{\frac{1}{\sqrt{L\alpha K}},\frac{1}{L},\frac{\varepsilon}{2L% }\right\}italic_Î³ = roman_min { divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_L italic_Î± italic_K end_ARG end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG } in FootnoteÂ 10, where

seconds.

Appendix D The Rennala Algorithm

We mention the Rennala SGD throughout the paper, here we provide a brief introduction to the method and its development. AlgorithmÂ 5 shows the work done by the server. Essentially, the server asynchronously waits to collect a batch of size Sğ‘†Sitalic_S, whenever it receives a gradient from a worker that has the same iteration as the algorithm, it assigns it to compute a gradient at the same point xksubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜x_{k}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. After collecting the batch, we preform a synchronous update (given that all gradients were made on the same point xksubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜x_{k}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT), using an average of the collected batch.

Appendix E The Classical SGD Theory

In this section, we present the classical SGD theory as developed by Ghadimi and Lan, (2013) and Khaled and RichtÃ¡rik, (2020). Our analysis will follow the approach of the latter.

We consider the stochastic gradient descent (SGD) method:

xk+1=xkâˆ’Î³â¢gâ¢(xk),superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜1superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜ğ›¾ğ‘”superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜x^{k+1}=x^{k}-\gamma g(x^{k}),italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_Î³ italic_g ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

where x0âˆˆâ„dsuperscriptğ‘¥0superscriptâ„ğ‘‘x^{0}\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the initial point, and gâ¢(x)ğ‘”ğ‘¥g(x)italic_g ( italic_x ) is a stochastic gradient estimator at xğ‘¥xitalic_x.

We make the following assumption:

Assumption E.1.

The stochastic gradient estimator gâ¢(x)ğ‘”ğ‘¥g(x)italic_g ( italic_x ) satisfies:

ğ”¼â¢[gâ¢(x)]=âˆ‡fâ¢(x)ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘”ğ‘¥âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]=\nabla f(x)blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] = âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x )
ğ”¼â¢[â€–gâ¢(x)â€–2]â‰¤2â¢Î±â¢(fâ¢(x)âˆ’finf)+Î²â¢â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2+Î¶,ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormğ‘”ğ‘¥22ğ›¼ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptğ‘“infimumğ›½superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥2ğœ\displaystyle{\mathbb{E}}\left[\left\|g(x)\right\|^{2}\right]\leq 2\alpha\left% (f(x)-f^{\inf}\right)+\beta\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\zeta,blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ italic_g ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] â‰¤ 2 italic_Î± ( italic_f ( italic_x ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Î² âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Î¶ ,

for all xâˆˆâ„dğ‘¥superscriptâ„ğ‘‘x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and some constants Î±,Î²,Î¶â‰¥0ğ›¼ğ›½ğœ0\alpha,\beta,\zeta\geq 0italic_Î± , italic_Î² , italic_Î¶ â‰¥ 0.

This assumption is both general and reasonable, and it is satisfied by many modern SGD-type methods. For further details, refer to Khaled and RichtÃ¡rik, (2020).

Under this assumption, we can derive the following convergence result.

Theorem E.2 (Corollary 1 (Khaled and RichtÃ¡rik, , 2020)).

Assume that AssumptionsÂ 4.1, 4.2 and E.1 hold. Then for any Îµ>0ğœ€0\varepsilon>0italic_Îµ > 0

min0â‰¤kâ‰¤Kâ¡ğ”¼â¢[â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(xk)â€–2]â‰¤Îµsubscript0ğ‘˜ğ¾ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜2ğœ€\displaystyle\min_{0\leq k\leq K}\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})\right% \|^{2}\right]\leq\varepsilonroman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 â‰¤ italic_k â‰¤ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] â‰¤ italic_Îµ

for

Î³=minâ¡{1Lâ¢Î±â¢K,1Lâ¢Î²,Îµ2â¢Lâ¢Î¶},ğ›¾1ğ¿ğ›¼ğ¾1ğ¿ğ›½ğœ€2ğ¿ğœ\displaystyle\gamma=\min\left\{\frac{1}{\sqrt{L\alpha K}},\frac{1}{L\beta},% \frac{\varepsilon}{2L\zeta}\right\},italic_Î³ = roman_min { divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_L italic_Î± italic_K end_ARG end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L italic_Î² end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L italic_Î¶ end_ARG } ,

and

Kâ‰¥12â¢Lâ¢(fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finf)Îµâ¢maxâ¡{Î²,12â¢Î”â¢Î±Îµ,2â¢Î¶Îµ}.ğ¾12ğ¿ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimumğœ€ğ›½12Î”ğ›¼ğœ€2ğœğœ€\displaystyle K\geq\frac{12L\left(f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}\right)}{\varepsilon}\max% \left\{\beta,\frac{12\Delta\alpha}{\varepsilon},\frac{2\zeta}{\varepsilon}% \right\}.italic_K â‰¥ divide start_ARG 12 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG roman_max { italic_Î² , divide start_ARG 12 roman_Î” italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_Î¶ end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG } .

Appendix F Proofs for Propositions in SectionÂ 3

Proposition 3.1.

Let Kğ¾Kitalic_K be the number of iterations required by Rennala SGD to find an Îµğœ€\varepsilonitalic_Îµ-stationary point. Then, for sufficiently small Îµğœ€\varepsilonitalic_Îµ, MindFlayer SGD needs K/pğ¾ğ‘K/pitalic_K / italic_p iterations to find an Îµğœ€\varepsilonitalic_Îµ-stationary point.

Proof.

The iterations of Rennala SGD can be viewed as iterations of Minibatch SGD. Thus, we can apply the classical SGD theory (TheoremÂ E.2) to derive its iteration complexity:

K=maxâ¡{1,Ïƒ2Îµâ¢B}â¢8â¢Lâ¢(fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finf)Îµ.ğ¾1superscriptğœ2ğœ€ğµ8ğ¿ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimumğœ€K=\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon B}\right\}\frac{8L(f(x^{0})-f^{% \inf})}{\varepsilon}.italic_K = roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG .

For MindFlayer SGD, the iteration complexity follows from TheoremÂ 4.4. Therefore, the number of iterations KMsubscriptğ¾ğ‘€K_{M}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT required for MindFlayer SGD to guarantee that

1KMâ¢âˆ‘k=0KMâˆ’1ğ”¼â¢[â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(xk)â€–2]â‰¤Îµ1subscriptğ¾ğ‘€superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0subscriptğ¾ğ‘€1ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜2ğœ€\frac{1}{K_{M}}\sum_{k=0}^{K_{M}-1}{\mathbb{E}}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})% \right\|^{2}\right]\leq\varepsilondivide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] â‰¤ italic_Îµ

is given by

KM=maxâ¡{1,Ïƒ2Îµâ¢Bâ¢p}â¢8â¢Lâ¢(fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finf)Îµ.subscriptğ¾ğ‘€1superscriptğœ2ğœ€ğµğ‘8ğ¿ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimumğœ€K_{M}=\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon Bp}\right\}\frac{8L(f(x^{0})-% f^{\inf})}{\varepsilon}.italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B italic_p end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG .

If Îµâ‰¤Ïƒ2Bğœ€superscriptğœ2ğµ\varepsilon\leq\frac{\sigma^{2}}{B}italic_Îµ â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG, we have

KM=Kp.subscriptğ¾ğ‘€ğ¾ğ‘K_{M}=\frac{K}{p}.italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_p end_ARG .

âˆ

Proposition 3.3.

For the n=1ğ‘›1n=1italic_n = 1 case, if s>Ï„+Medâ¢[Î·]ğ‘ ğœMeddelimited-[]ğœ‚s>\tau+\mathrm{Med}[\eta]italic_s > italic_Ï„ + roman_Med [ italic_Î· ] then MindFlayer SGD is faster than Rennala SGD. Moreover, if s=(Ï„+Medâ¢[Î·])â¢(2â¢Î±âˆ’1)ğ‘ ğœMeddelimited-[]ğœ‚2ğ›¼1s=\left(\tau+\mathrm{Med}[\eta]\right)\left(2\alpha-1\right)italic_s = ( italic_Ï„ + roman_Med [ italic_Î· ] ) ( 2 italic_Î± - 1 ) then

Tğ–±ğ–¾ğ—‡ğ—‡ğ–ºğ—…ğ–ºğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£Tğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£â¢(Medâ¢[Î·])â‰¥Î±.subscriptğ‘‡ğ–±ğ–¾ğ—‡ğ—‡ğ–ºğ—…ğ–ºğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£subscriptğ‘‡ğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£Meddelimited-[]ğœ‚ğ›¼\frac{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}RennalaSGD}}}{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[% rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}% MindFlayerSGD}}\left(\mathrm{Med}[\eta]\right)}\geq\alpha.divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_RennalaSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_Med [ italic_Î· ] ) end_ARG â‰¥ italic_Î± .
Proof.

Let t=Med[Î·]=:mt=\mathrm{Med}[\eta]=:mitalic_t = roman_Med [ italic_Î· ] = : italic_m, then we have

Tğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£â¢(m)â‰¤Kpâ¢Bâ¢(Ï„+t)=2â¢Kâ¢Bâ¢(Ï„+m),subscriptğ‘‡ğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£ğ‘šğ¾ğ‘ğµğœğ‘¡2ğ¾ğµğœğ‘šT_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}(m)\leq\frac{K}{p}B(\tau+t)% =2KB\left(\tau+m\right),italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_m ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_p end_ARG italic_B ( italic_Ï„ + italic_t ) = 2 italic_K italic_B ( italic_Ï„ + italic_m ) ,
Tğ–±ğ–¾ğ—‡ğ—‡ğ–ºğ—…ğ–ºğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£=Kâ¢Bâ¢(Ï„+ğ”¼â¢[Î·])=Kâ¢Bâ¢(Ï„+m+s),subscriptğ‘‡ğ–±ğ–¾ğ—‡ğ—‡ğ–ºğ—…ğ–ºğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£ğ¾ğµğœğ”¼delimited-[]ğœ‚ğ¾ğµğœğ‘šğ‘ T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}RennalaSGD}}=KB(\tau+\mathbb{E}\left[\eta% \right])=KB(\tau+m+s),italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_RennalaSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_K italic_B ( italic_Ï„ + blackboard_E [ italic_Î· ] ) = italic_K italic_B ( italic_Ï„ + italic_m + italic_s ) ,

Thus if s>Ï„+mğ‘ ğœğ‘šs>\tau+mitalic_s > italic_Ï„ + italic_m then MindFlayer SGD is faster than Rennala SGD.

Now, let s=(Ï„+m)â¢(2â¢Î±âˆ’1)ğ‘ ğœğ‘š2ğ›¼1s=\left(\tau+m\right)\left(2\alpha-1\right)italic_s = ( italic_Ï„ + italic_m ) ( 2 italic_Î± - 1 ) then

Tğ–±ğ–¾ğ—‡ğ—‡ğ–ºğ—…ğ–ºğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£Tğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£â¢(m)â‰¥Ï„+m+s2â¢(Ï„+m)=2â¢Î±â¢(Ï„+m)2â¢(Ï„+m)=Î±.subscriptğ‘‡ğ–±ğ–¾ğ—‡ğ—‡ğ–ºğ—…ğ–ºğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£subscriptğ‘‡ğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£ğ‘šğœğ‘šğ‘ 2ğœğ‘š2ğ›¼ğœğ‘š2ğœğ‘šğ›¼\frac{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}RennalaSGD}}}{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[% rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}% MindFlayerSGD}}\left(m\right)}\geq\frac{\tau+m+s}{2\left(\tau+m\right)}=\frac{% 2\alpha\left(\tau+m\right)}{2\left(\tau+m\right)}=\alpha.divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_RennalaSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_ARG â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_Ï„ + italic_m + italic_s end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( italic_Ï„ + italic_m ) end_ARG = divide start_ARG 2 italic_Î± ( italic_Ï„ + italic_m ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( italic_Ï„ + italic_m ) end_ARG = italic_Î± .

âˆ

Appendix G Proofs for Homogeneous Regime

G.1 Proof of TheoremÂ 4.4

First, we rewrite MindFlayer SGD in a classical SGD way where we do gradient step with an unbiased estimator of the gradient at each iteration.

where B=âˆ‘i=1npiâ¢Biğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, pi=Fâ¢(ti)=Pâ¢(Î·iâ‰¤ti)subscriptğ‘ğ‘–ğ¹subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘ƒsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–p_{i}=F(t_{i})=P(\eta_{i}\leq t_{i})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_P ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and Iâ¢(â‹…)ğ¼â‹…I(\cdot)italic_I ( â‹… ) denotes the indicator function. To prove the theorem we need to establish some properties of the gradient estimator. First, we need an unbiased estimator.

Lemma G.1 (Proof in SectionÂ G.1.1).

The gradient estimator in AlgorithmÂ 7 given by

gâ¢(x):=1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1nâˆ‘j=1BiIâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)assignğ‘”ğ‘¥1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

is unbiased, i.e., ğ”¼â¢[gâ¢(x)]=âˆ‡fâ¢(x)ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘”ğ‘¥âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]=\nabla f(x)blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] = âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) for all xâˆˆâ„dğ‘¥superscriptâ„ğ‘‘x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Next, we obtain an upper bound for the variance of this estimator.

Lemma G.2 (Proof in SectionÂ G.1.2).

The gradient estimator in AlgorithmÂ 7 given by

gâ¢(x):=1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1nâˆ‘j=1BiIâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)assignğ‘”ğ‘¥1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

satisfies

ğ”¼â¢[â€–gâ¢(x)2â€–]â‰¤2â¢â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2+1Bâ¢Ïƒ2.ğ”¼delimited-[]normğ‘”superscriptğ‘¥22superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥21ğµsuperscriptğœ2\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|g(x)^{2}\right\|\right]\leq 2\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|% ^{2}+\frac{1}{B}\sigma^{2}.blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ italic_g ( italic_x ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ ] â‰¤ 2 âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

We are ready to prove the TheoremÂ 4.4.

Theorem 4.4.

Assume that AssumptionsÂ 4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 hold. Let B=âˆ‘i=1npiâ¢Biğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Î³=12â¢Lâ¢minâ¡{1,Îµâ¢BÏƒ2}ğ›¾12ğ¿1ğœ€ğµsuperscriptğœ2\gamma=\frac{1}{2L}\min\left\{1,\frac{\varepsilon B}{\sigma^{2}}\right\}italic_Î³ = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG roman_min { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } in FootnoteÂ 7. Then, after

Kâ‰¥maxâ¡{1,Ïƒ2Îµâ¢B}â¢8â¢Lâ¢(fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finf)Îµğ¾1superscriptğœ2ğœ€ğµ8ğ¿ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimumğœ€K\geq\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon B}\right\}\frac{8L\left(f(x^{0% })-f^{\inf}\right)}{\varepsilon}italic_K â‰¥ roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG

iterations, the method guarantees that 1Kâ¢âˆ‘k=0Kâˆ’1ğ”¼â¢[â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(xk)â€–2]â‰¤Îµ1ğ¾superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ¾1ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜2ğœ€\frac{1}{K}\sum_{k=0}^{K-1}{\mathbb{E}}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})\right\|^{2% }\right]\leq\varepsilondivide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] â‰¤ italic_Îµ.

Proof.

Note that FootnoteÂ 7 can be viewed as a special case of classical stochastic gradient descent (SGD), as reformulated in AlgorithmÂ 7. We need to verify that the gradient estimator fulfills the conditions required by classical SGD (TheoremÂ E.2). The two preceding lemmas address this requirement precisely. Specifically, LemmaÂ G.1 confirms that the gradient estimator used in AlgorithmÂ 7 is unbiased, while LemmaÂ G.2 verifies that the variance of this estimator meets the conditions specified in E.1, with Î±=0ğ›¼0\alpha=0italic_Î± = 0, Î²=2ğ›½2\beta=2italic_Î² = 2 and Î¶=Ïƒ2Bğœsuperscriptğœ2ğµ\zeta=\frac{\sigma^{2}}{B}italic_Î¶ = divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG. Consequently, it remains to apply TheoremÂ E.2. âˆ

G.1.1 Proof of LemmaÂ G.1

Lemma G.1.

The gradient estimator in AlgorithmÂ 7 given by

gâ¢(x):=1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1nâˆ‘j=1BiIâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)assignğ‘”ğ‘¥1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

is unbiased, i.e., ğ”¼â¢[gâ¢(x)]=âˆ‡fâ¢(x)ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘”ğ‘¥âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]=\nabla f(x)blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] = âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) for all xâˆˆâ„dğ‘¥superscriptâ„ğ‘‘x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where B=âˆ‘i=1npiâ¢Biğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof.

This follows from direct computation:

ğ”¼â¢[gâ¢(x)]ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘”ğ‘¥\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] =\displaystyle== ğ”¼â¢[1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1nâˆ‘j=1BiIâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)]ğ”¼delimited-[]1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left% (\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)\right]blackboard_E [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ]
=\displaystyle== 1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1nâˆ‘j=1Biğ”¼â¢[Iâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)]1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—\displaystyle\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}\mathbb{E}\left[I\left% (\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)\right]divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ]
=(Î·ijâŸ‚âŸ‚Î¾ij)\displaystyle\overset{\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\perp\!\!\!\!\perp\xi_{i}^{j}\right)}{=}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ‚ âŸ‚ italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG = end_ARG 1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1nâˆ‘j=1Biğ”¼â¢[Iâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)]â¢ğ”¼â¢[âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)]1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ”¼delimited-[]âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—\displaystyle\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}\mathbb{E}\left[I\left% (\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\right]\mathbb{E}\left[\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{% j}\right)\right]divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] blackboard_E [ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ]

=\displaystyle== âˆ‡fâ¢(x).âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥\displaystyle\nabla f(x).âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) .

âˆ

G.1.2 Proof of LemmaÂ G.2

Lemma G.2.

The gradient estimator in AlgorithmÂ 7 given by

gâ¢(x):=1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1nâˆ‘j=1BiIâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)assignğ‘”ğ‘¥1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

satisfies

ğ”¼â¢[â€–gâ¢(x)2â€–]â‰¤2â¢â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2+1Bâ¢Ïƒ2,ğ”¼delimited-[]normğ‘”superscriptğ‘¥22superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥21ğµsuperscriptğœ2\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|g(x)^{2}\right\|\right]\leq 2\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|% ^{2}+\frac{1}{B}\sigma^{2},blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ italic_g ( italic_x ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ ] â‰¤ 2 âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where B=âˆ‘i=1npiâ¢Biğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof.

In order to simplify notation, let

ai:=âˆ‘j=1Bibij,assignsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–ğ‘—a_{i}:=\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}b_{i}^{j},italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where

bij:=Iâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij).assignsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–ğ‘—ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—b_{i}^{j}:=I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}% \right).italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

Step 1 (Initial expression). We express ğ”¼â¢[â€–gâ¢(x)â€–2]ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormğ‘”ğ‘¥2\mathbb{E}\left[\|g(x)\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ italic_g ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] in terms of aisubscriptğ‘ğ‘–a_{i}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT:

ğ”¼â¢[â€–gâ¢(x)â€–2]ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormğ‘”ğ‘¥2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|g(x)\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ italic_g ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] =\displaystyle== ğ”¼â¢[â€–1Bâ¢âˆ‘i=1naiâ€–2]=1B2â¢ğ”¼â¢[âˆ‘i=1nâ€–aiâ€–2+âˆ‘iâ‰ jâŸ¨ai,ajâŸ©].ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnorm1ğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–21superscriptğµ2ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptnormsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–2subscriptğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘—\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}a_{i}\right\|^{2}% \right]=\frac{1}{B^{2}}\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left\|a_{i}\right\|^{2}+% \sum_{i\neq j}\left\langle a_{i},a_{j}\right\rangle\right].blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_E [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i â‰  italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ¨ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© ] .

We further simplify both terms via:

Step 2. (Finding the expectations). Further

=(Î·ijâŸ‚âŸ‚Î¾ij)\displaystyle\overset{\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\perp\!\!\!\!\perp\xi_{i}^{j}\right)}{=}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ‚ âŸ‚ italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG = end_ARG ğ”¼â¢[(Iâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti))2]â¢ğ”¼â¢[â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)â€–2]ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–2ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left(I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\right)% ^{2}\right]\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)\right\|^{% 2}\right]blackboard_E [ ( italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
â‰¤\displaystyle\leqâ‰¤ piâ¢(â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2+ğ”¼â¢[â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ij)âˆ’âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2])subscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥2ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥2\displaystyle p_{i}\left(\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\mathbb{E}\left[\left% \|\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)-\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}\right]\right)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] )
â‰¤(4.3)4.3\displaystyle\overset{\left(\lx@cref{creftypecap~refnum}{ass:stochastic_varian% ce_bounded}\right)}{\leq}start_OVERACCENT ( ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG â‰¤ end_ARG piâ¢(â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2+Ïƒ2),subscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥2superscriptğœ2\displaystyle p_{i}\left(\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\sigma^{2}\right),italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

and

ğ”¼â¢[âŸ¨bik,bjlâŸ©]ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—ğ‘™\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\langle b_{i}^{k},b_{j}^{l}\right\rangle\right]blackboard_E [ âŸ¨ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ© ] =\displaystyle== ğ”¼â¢[âŸ¨Iâ¢(Î·ikâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾ik),Iâ¢(Î·jlâ‰¤tj)â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(x;Î¾jl)âŸ©]ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘—ğ‘™subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘—âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘—ğ‘™\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\langle I\left(\eta_{i}^{k}\leq t_{i}\right)% \nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{k}\right),I\left(\eta_{j}^{l}\leq t_{j}\right)\nabla f% \left(x;\xi_{j}^{l}\right)\right\rangle\right]blackboard_E [ âŸ¨ italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âŸ© ] (9)

ğ”¼â¢[âˆ‘i=1nâ€–aiâ€–2]ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptnormsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left\|a_{i}\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] â‰¤\displaystyle\leqâ‰¤ Bâ¢â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2+Bâ¢Ïƒ2+â€–âˆ‡fâ¢(x)â€–2â¢âˆ‘i=1nBi2â¢pi2.ğµsuperscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥2ğµsuperscriptğœ2superscriptnormâˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğµğ‘–2superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–2\displaystyle B\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+B\sigma^{2}+\left\|\nabla f(x)% \right\|^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}B_{i}^{2}p_{i}^{2}.italic_B âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_B italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + âˆ¥ âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

âˆ

G.2 Proof of TheoremÂ 4.5

The following lemma gives time complexity for any choice of B1,â€¦,Bnsubscriptğµ1â€¦subscriptğµğ‘›B_{1},\ldots,B_{n}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and t=(t1,â€¦,tn)ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¡1â€¦subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘›t=\left(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\right)italic_t = ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) in MindFlayer SGD.

Lemma G.3 (Proof in SectionÂ G.2.1).

Assume that AssumptionsÂ 4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 hold. Let B=âˆ‘i=1npiâ¢Biğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Î³=12â¢Lâ¢minâ¡{1,Îµâ¢BÏƒ2}ğ›¾12ğ¿1ğœ€ğµsuperscriptğœ2\gamma=\frac{1}{2L}\min\left\{1,\frac{\varepsilon B}{\sigma^{2}}\right\}italic_Î³ = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG roman_min { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } in MethodÂ 7. Then after

Tğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£â¢(t)â‰¥maxiâˆˆ[n]â¡{Biâ¢(Ï„i+ti)}â¢maxâ¡{1,Ïƒ2Îµâ¢B}â¢8â¢Lâ¢(fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finf)Îµsubscriptğ‘‡ğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›subscriptğµğ‘–subscriptğœğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–1superscriptğœ2ğœ€ğµ8ğ¿ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimumğœ€T_{{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}}(t)\geq\max_{i\in[n]}\{B_{% i}\left(\tau_{i}+t_{i}\right)\}\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon B}% \right\}\frac{8L\left(f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}\right)}{\varepsilon}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) â‰¥ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i âˆˆ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG

seconds, the method guarantees to find an Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilonitalic_Ïµ-stationary point.

Now we are ready to prove the theorem.

Theorem 4.5.

Assume that AssumptionsÂ 4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 hold. Let B=âˆ‘i=1npiâ¢Biğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Î³=12â¢Lâ¢minâ¡{1,Îµâ¢BÏƒ2}ğ›¾12ğ¿1ğœ€ğµsuperscriptğœ2\gamma=\frac{1}{2L}\min\left\{1,\frac{\varepsilon B}{\sigma^{2}}\right\}italic_Î³ = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG roman_min { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } in MethodÂ 7. Let t=(t1,â€¦,tn)ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¡1â€¦subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘›t=\left(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\right)italic_t = ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), t1,â€¦,tnâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘¡1â€¦subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘›0t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\geq 0italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0. Without loss of generality assume that 0<Ï„1+t1â‰¤â‹¯â‰¤Ï„n+tn0subscriptğœ1subscriptğ‘¡1â‹¯subscriptğœğ‘›subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘›0<\tau_{1}+t_{1}\leq\cdots\leq\tau_{n}+t_{n}0 < italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ â‹¯ â‰¤ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let

tâ¢(m)=(âˆ‘j=1mpjÏ„j+tj)âˆ’1â¢(S+âˆ‘j=1mpj),ğ‘¡ğ‘šsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğœğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘—1ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—t(m)=\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_{j}}\right)^{-1}\left(S+\sum_% {j=1}^{m}p_{j}\right),italic_t ( italic_m ) = ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_S + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where S=maxâ¡{1,Ïƒ2Îµ}ğ‘†1superscriptğœ2ğœ€S=\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon}\right\}italic_S = roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG }. Let mâˆ—=argâ¡minmâˆˆ[n]â¡tâ¢(m)superscriptğ‘šsubscriptğ‘šdelimited-[]ğ‘›ğ‘¡ğ‘šm^{*}=\arg\min_{m\in[n]}t(m)italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m âˆˆ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ( italic_m ), if there are several minimizers we take the smallest one. Put

Bi=âŒˆbiâŒ‰,bi={tâ¢(mâˆ—)Ï„i+tiâˆ’1,ifâ¢iâ‰¤mâˆ—,0,ifâ¢i>mâˆ—.formulae-sequencesubscriptğµğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–casesğ‘¡superscriptğ‘šsubscriptğœğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–1ifğ‘–superscriptğ‘š0ifğ‘–superscriptğ‘šB_{i}=\lceil b_{i}\rceil,\quad b_{i}=\begin{cases}\frac{t(m^{*})}{\tau_{i}+t_{% i}}-1,&\text{if}\enspace i\leq m^{*},\\ 0,&\text{if}\enspace i>m^{*}.\end{cases}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âŒˆ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŒ‰ , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - 1 , end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i â‰¤ italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i > italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW

Then, MindFlayer SGD guarantees to find an Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilonitalic_Ïµ-stationary point after

Tğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£â¢(t)â‰¥8Ã—minmâˆˆ[n]â¡{(1mâ¢âˆ‘j=1mpjÏ„j+tj)âˆ’1â¢(Sm+1mâ¢âˆ‘j=1mpj)â¢Î”â¢LÎµ}subscriptğ‘‡ğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£ğ‘¡8subscriptğ‘šdelimited-[]ğ‘›superscript1ğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğœğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘—1ğ‘†ğ‘š1ğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—Î”ğ¿ğœ€T_{{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}}(t)\geq 8\times\min_{m\in[% n]}\left\{\left(\frac{1}{m}\sum_{j=1}^{m}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_{j}}\right)^{% -1}\left(\frac{S}{m}+\frac{1}{m}\sum_{j=1}^{m}p_{j}\right)\frac{\Delta L}{% \varepsilon}\right\}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) â‰¥ 8 Ã— roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m âˆˆ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG roman_Î” italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG }

seconds, where Î”=fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finfÎ”ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimum\Delta=f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}roman_Î” = italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Proof.

First we show that Bisubscriptğµğ‘–B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-s are valid choice, i.e. bi>0subscriptğ‘ğ‘–0b_{i}>0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 for iâ‰¤mâˆ—ğ‘–superscriptğ‘ši\leq m^{*}italic_i â‰¤ italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. If mâˆ—=1superscriptğ‘š1m^{*}=1italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1, then tâ¢(1)=Ï„1+t1p1â¢(S+p1)ğ‘¡1subscriptğœ1subscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘1t(1)=\frac{\tau_{1}+t_{1}}{p_{1}}(S+p_{1})italic_t ( 1 ) = divide start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_S + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), thus b1=Sp1>0subscriptğ‘1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘10b_{1}=\frac{S}{p_{1}}>0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG > 0. From the last inequality, we get that Ï„mâˆ—+tmâˆ—<tâ¢(mâˆ—)subscriptğœsuperscriptğ‘šsubscriptğ‘¡superscriptğ‘šğ‘¡superscriptğ‘š\tau_{m^{*}}+t_{m^{*}}<t(m^{*})italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_t ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), thus biâ‰¥bmâˆ—>0subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘superscriptğ‘š0b_{i}\geq b_{m^{*}}>0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 for all iâ‰¤mâˆ—ğ‘–superscriptğ‘ši\leq m^{*}italic_i â‰¤ italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

It remains to find the time complexity with these choices of Bisubscriptğµğ‘–B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. From LemmaÂ G.3, we have that the time complexity is

Then,

On the other hand

=\displaystyle== (âˆ‘j=1mâˆ—pjÏ„j+tj)âˆ’1â¢(S+âˆ‘j=1mâˆ—pj)â¢âˆ‘i=1mâˆ—piÏ„i+tiâˆ’âˆ‘i=1mâˆ—pi=Sâ‰¥Ïƒ2Îµ.superscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1superscriptğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğœğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘—1ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1superscriptğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1superscriptğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğœğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1superscriptğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–ğ‘†superscriptğœ2ğœ€\displaystyle\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m^{*}}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_{j}}\right)^{-1}% \left(S+\sum_{j=1}^{m^{*}}p_{j}\right)\sum_{i=1}^{m^{*}}\frac{p_{i}}{\tau_{i}+% t_{i}}-\sum_{i=1}^{m^{*}}p_{i}=S\geq\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon}.( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_S + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_S â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG .

Therefore, the time complexity is

Tğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£â¢(t)subscriptğ‘‡ğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£ğ‘¡\displaystyle T_{{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[% named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}}(t)italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) â‰¥\displaystyle\geqâ‰¥ tâ¢(mâˆ—)â¢8â¢Î”â¢LÎµğ‘¡superscriptğ‘š8Î”ğ¿ğœ€\displaystyle t(m^{*})\frac{8\Delta L}{\varepsilon}italic_t ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG 8 roman_Î” italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG
=\displaystyle== minmâˆˆ[n]â¡{(âˆ‘j=1mpjÏ„j+tj)âˆ’1â¢(S+âˆ‘j=1mpj)}â¢8â¢Î”â¢LÎµ.subscriptğ‘šdelimited-[]ğ‘›superscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğœğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘—1ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—8Î”ğ¿ğœ€\displaystyle\min_{m\in[n]}\left\{\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_% {j}}\right)^{-1}\left(S+\sum_{j=1}^{m}p_{j}\right)\right\}\frac{8\Delta L}{% \varepsilon}.roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m âˆˆ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_S + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } divide start_ARG 8 roman_Î” italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG .

âˆ

G.2.1 Proof of LemmaÂ G.3

Lemma G.3.

Assume that AssumptionsÂ 4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 hold. Let B=âˆ‘i=1npiâ¢Biğµsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Î³=12â¢Lâ¢minâ¡{1,Îµâ¢BÏƒ2}ğ›¾12ğ¿1ğœ€ğµsuperscriptğœ2\gamma=\frac{1}{2L}\min\left\{1,\frac{\varepsilon B}{\sigma^{2}}\right\}italic_Î³ = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG roman_min { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } in MethodÂ 7. Then after

Tğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£â¢(t)â‰¥maxiâˆˆ[n]â¡{Biâ¢(Ï„i+ti)}â¢maxâ¡{1,Ïƒ2Îµâ¢B}â¢8â¢Lâ¢(fâ¢(x0)âˆ’finf)Îµsubscriptğ‘‡ğ–¬ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ–½ğ–¥ğ—…ğ–ºğ—’ğ–¾ğ—‹ğ–²ğ–¦ğ–£ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›subscriptğµğ‘–subscriptğœğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–1superscriptğœ2ğœ€ğµ8ğ¿ğ‘“subscriptğ‘¥0superscriptğ‘“infimumğœ€T_{{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}}(t)\geq\max_{i\in[n]}\{B_{% i}\left(\tau_{i}+t_{i}\right)\}\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon B}% \right\}\frac{8L\left(f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}\right)}{\varepsilon}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) â‰¥ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i âˆˆ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ italic_B end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG

seconds, the method guarantees to find an Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilonitalic_Ïµ-stationary point.

Proof.

Tijâ¢(ti)={Ï„i+Î·ij,ifâ¢Î·ijâ‰¤ti,Ï„i+ti,ifâ¢Î·ij>ti.superscriptsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–casessubscriptğœğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—ifsuperscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğœğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ifsuperscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–T_{i}^{j}(t_{i})=\begin{cases}\tau_{i}+\eta_{i}^{j},&\text{if}\enspace\eta_{i}% ^{j}\leq t_{i},\\ \tau_{i}+t_{i},&\text{if}\enspace\eta_{i}^{j}>t_{i}.\end{cases}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL if italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL if italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (10)

Thus, the random time taken for client iğ‘–iitalic_i to finish itâ€™s all bisubscriptğ‘ğ‘–b_{i}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT trials is

ğ’¯iâ¢(ti):=âˆ‘j=1biTijâ¢(ti)â‰¤biâ¢(Ï„i+ti).assignsubscriptğ’¯ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğ‘ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğœğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–\mathcal{T}_{i}(t_{i}):=\sum_{j=1}^{b_{i}}T_{i}^{j}(t_{i})\leq b_{i}\left(\tau% _{i}+t_{i}\right).caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (11)

Finally, let ğ’¯ğ’¯\mathcal{T}caligraphic_T be the random time required for one iteration of MindFlayer SGD. We get

ğ’¯=maxiâˆˆ[n]â¡ğ’¯iâ¢(ti)â‰¤maxiâˆˆ[n]â¡{biâ¢(Ï„i+ti)}.ğ’¯subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›subscriptğ’¯ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–subscriptğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğœğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–\mathcal{T}=\max_{i\in[n]}\mathcal{T}_{i}(t_{i})\leq\max_{i\in[n]}\{b_{i}\left% (\tau_{i}+t_{i}\right)\}.caligraphic_T = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i âˆˆ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i âˆˆ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } . (12)

It remains to multiply ğ’¯ğ’¯\mathcal{T}caligraphic_T with the number of iterations Kğ¾Kitalic_K given by TheoremÂ 4.4. âˆ

Appendix H Proofs for Heterogeneous Regime

H.1 Proof of TheoremÂ C.1

Here, we rewrite Vecna SGD (FootnoteÂ 10) in a classical SGD way.

where pi=Fâ¢(ti)=Pâ¢(Î·iâ‰¤ti)subscriptğ‘ğ‘–ğ¹subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘ƒsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–p_{i}=F(t_{i})=P(\eta_{i}\leq t_{i})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_P ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

To prove the theorem we need to establish some properties of the gradient estimator. First, we need an unbiased estimator.

Lemma H.1 (Proof in SectionÂ H.1.1).

The gradient estimator in AlgorithmÂ 8 given by

gâ¢(x):=1nâ¢âˆ‘i=1n1piâ¢Biâ¢âˆ‘j=1BiIâ¢(Î·ijâ‰¤ti)â¢âˆ‡fiâ¢(x;Î¾ij)assignğ‘”ğ‘¥1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›1subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğµğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğµğ‘–ğ¼superscriptsubscriptğœ‚ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptğœ‰ğ‘–ğ‘—g(x):=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1}{p_{i}B_{i}}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(% \eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\nabla f_{i}\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ‡ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ; italic_Î¾ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

is unbiased, i.e., ğ”¼â¢[gâ¢(x)]=âˆ‡fâ¢(x)ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘”ğ‘¥âˆ‡ğ‘“ğ‘¥\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]=\nabla f(x)blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] = âˆ‡ italic_f ( italic_x ) for all xâˆˆâ„dğ‘¥superscriptâ„ğ‘‘x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Next, we obtain an upper bound for the variance of this estimator.

Lemma H.2 (Proof in SectionÂ H.1.2).

The gradient estimator in AlgorithmÂ 8 given by
